main.p: Your Trust Score on Trademeda indicates the credibility and reliability of your business in the eyes of potential partners. A higher score significantly boosts your chances of securing valuable business opportunities. You can improve your Trust Score by verifying your account, maintaining a detailed and up-to-date profile, presenting a thorough product catalog, and earning positive reviews from users you interact with.
main.h3: How is the Trust Score Calculated?
main.p: The Trust Score is determined by a combination of buyer feedback, peer ratings, and the longevity of your account on the platform. While a perfect score of 10 is uncommon, there’s no need to worry if your score begins low. By regularly updating your profile, providing accurate information, and avoiding negative feedback, your Trust Score will gradually improve. Below are the key factors that contribute to your score.

ul.li: Receiving positive feedback and ratings from your peers.
Uploading relevant documentation and receiving ratings for it.
Verifying your profile by submitting necessary company documentation.
Listing products with high-quality images, detailed descriptions, and clear pricing.
The duration of your active profile on Trademeda.
Maintaining an active and uninterrupted Premium membership.
Receiving negative feedback or low ratings from peers.

main.p: Your Trust Score is an essential measure of your business’s reliability and trustworthiness. It plays a significant role in attracting inquiries from potential buyers on Trademeda. Moreover, your Trust Score positions you relative to other businesses on the platform: higher scores lead to better visibility in search results, resulting in greater opportunities for growth and business success.
